text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
HIVH 0..*BaseHIV.H Follow-up Logical Model
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
reasonForFollowUp 1..1stringReason for follow-up
missedCareVisit 1..1stringMissed care visit
missedMedicationPickup 1..1stringMissed medication pickup
didNotInitiateArt 1..1stringDid not initiate ART
incompleteVisit 1..1stringIncomplete visit
inconclusiveHivStatus 1..1stringInconclusive HIV status
testResultsReceived 1..1stringTest results received
otherFollowUpReason 1..1stringOther follow-up reason
otherFollowUpReasonSpecify 1..1stringOther follow-up reason (specify)
clientContactAttempted 1..1stringClient contact attempted
dateOfContactAttempt 1..1stringDate of contact attempt
contactAttemptedBy 1..1stringContact attempted by
contactMethod 1..1stringContact method
homeVisit 1..1stringHome visit
textMessage 1..1stringText message
phone 1..1stringPhone
sourceOfInformation 1..1stringSource of information
client 1..1stringClient
informedByTreatmentProvider 1..1stringInformed by treatment provider
informedByFamilyOrPartner 1..1stringInformed by family or partner
otherSourceOfInformation 1..1stringOther source of information
otherSourceOfInformationSpecify 1..1stringOther source of information (specify)
outcomeFromOutreachAttempt 1..1stringOutcome from outreach attempt
returningToClinic 1..1stringReturning to clinic
selfTransferredOut 1..1stringSelf-transferred out
hospitalized 1..1stringHospitalized
refusedToReturn 1..1stringRefused to return
notLocated 1..1stringNot located
diedReported 1..1stringDied (reported)
movedFromCatchmentArea 1..1stringMoved from catchment area
dateClientMovedFromCatchmentArea 1..1stringDate client moved from catchment area
newCatchmentArea 1..1stringNew catchment area
partnerOrContactOfIndexCase 1..1stringPartner or contact of index case
hivStatusOfPartnerOrContact 1..1stringHIV status of partner or contact
alreadyKnewPositive 1..1stringAlready knew positive
newlyDiagnosed 1..1stringNewly diagnosed
negative 1..1stringNegative
dateOfDeath 1..1stringDate of death
causeOfDeath 1..1stringCause of death
placeOfDeath 1..1stringPlace of death
hivTreatmentOutcome 1..1stringHIV treatment outcome
lostToFollowUp 1..1stringLost to follow-up
transferredOut 1..1stringTransferred out
deathDocumented 1..1stringDeath (documented)
refusedStoppedTreatment 1..1stringRefused (stopped) treatment
datePatientLostToFollowUp 1..1stringDate patient lost to follow-up
onArt 1..1stringOn ART
dateHivTreatmentOutcomeChanged 1..1stringDate HIV treatment outcome changed
transferConfirmed 1..1stringTransfer confirmed
transferToFacility 1..1stringTransfer to facility
dateOfTransferOut 1..1stringDate of transfer out
adherenceAssessment 1..1stringAdherence assessment
reasonsForAdherenceProblem 1..1stringReason(s) for adherence problem
forgot 1..1stringForgot
toxicitysideEffects2 1..1stringToxicity/side effects
busy 1..1stringBusy
changeOfRoutine 1..1stringChange of routine
travelCost 1..1stringTravel cost
distanceToClinic 1..1stringDistance to clinic
clientLostRanOutOfPills 1..1stringClient lost/ran out of pills
stockOut 1..1stringStock-out
tooIll 1..1stringToo ill
pillBurden 1..1stringPill burden
feltWell 1..1stringFelt well
depression 1..1stringDepression
alcoholUse 1..1stringAlcohol use
substanceUse 1..1stringSubstance use
stigmadisclosureConcerns 1..1stringStigma/disclosure concerns
lackOfFood 1..1stringLack of food
poorPalatability 1..1stringPoor palatability
adhrOther 1..1stringOther
adhrOtherSpecify 1..1stringOther (specify)
dateArtStopped 1..1stringDate ART stopped
reasonArtStopped 1..1stringReason ART stopped
toxicitysideEffects 1..1stringToxicity/side effects
severeIllnessHospitalization 1..1stringSevere illness, hospitalization
drugsOutOfStock 1..1stringDrugs out of stock
clientLacksFinances 1..1stringClient lacks finances
excludedHivInfectionInInfant 1..1stringExcluded HIV infection in infant
otherReasonForStoppingArt 1..1stringOther reason for stopping ART
otherReasonForStoppingArtSpecify 1..1stringOther reason for stopping ART (specify)

Documentation for this format

name: HIVH
title: HIV.H Follow-up Logical Model
description: Logical Model for HIV.H Follow-up data elements.

element.definition: Logical Model for HIV.H Follow-up data elements.
The reason why the client is being followed up
Client did not present for a care appointment as scheduled / as expected
Client did not pick up medication as scheduled from pharmacy or other drug distribution point
Client did not initiate ART at the same time as diagnosis (e.g., because they required additional counselling) and required follow-up for ART initiation
Client presented for care, but left before services were completed, e.g., due to long wait times or not staying to have labs taken
Client has not returned for a follow-up test after an inconclusive test result
Client needs to be informed of test results (e.g., viral load)
Client was followed up for another reason
Client was followed up for another reason (specify)
An attempt to locate the client was made
Date of attempt to contact client
Who attempted to reach out to the client
Method used to try to reach out to the client
Contacted client at home
Contacted client by short message service (SMS) text
Contacted client by phone call
Source of information about the client
The client was the source of information
Source of information was a treatment provider of the client
Source of information was a family member of partner
Information about the clients status was provided by someone else
Information about the clients status was provided by someone else (specify)
Detailed outcome from the attempt to locate the client
Client was located and agreed to return to clinic
Client transferred to another facility for care (client-initiated transfer, not provider-initiated transfer)
Client was hospitalized
Client was found but declined to return to treatment
Attempt was made to locate client, but client was not found
The client was reported as having died
The client moved from the catchment area (may be reported from the community level)

element.short: Date client moved from catchment area
element.definition: The date on which the client moved from the catchment area, if known
New catchment area where the client resides

element.short: Partner or contact of index case
element.definition: The client was identified by an index case as a partner or contact

element.short: HIV status of partner or contact
element.definition: HIV status of the partner or contact given by the index case
The partner or contact of the index case already knew they are HIV-positive
The partner or contact of the index case is newly diagnosed as HIV-positive
The partner or contact of the index case is newly diagnosed is HIV-negative
If deceased, the date that the client died
Cause of death, if known
Where the client died, if known
The outcome for the client which is used for reporting retention/attrition.
Twenty-eight days or more since last missed appointment
The client transferred to another facility
People living with HIV previously on ART who are confirmed to have died from any cause
Client was contacted and confirmed to have stopped ART (reasons may include stigma and discrimination, faith healing, etc.)
Date patient was lost to follow-up (LTFU)
Client is currently taking ART
The date on which the clients outcome (lost to follow-up, transferred out, death (documented), or refused (stopped) treatment) changed
Select if transfer to another facility is confirmed
Name of health facility client was transferred to
The date the client transferred out of the facility to be provided with care at another facility
Whether client is adherent or not to ART regimen per national guidelines (immunological or virological monitoring)
Reason why client is not adherent
Client reported not being adherent because they forgot
Client reported not being adherent because of toxicity/side effects
Client reported not being adherent because they were busy
Client reported not being adherent because of a change of routine
Client reported not being adherent because of travel cost
Client reported not being adherent because of distance to clinic
Client reported not being adherent because of client lost/ran out of pills
Client reported not being adherent because of a stock-out
Client reported not being adherent because of being too ill
Client reported not being adherent because of the pill burden
Client reported not being adherent because they felt well
Client reported not being adherent because of depression
Client reported not being adherent because of alcohol use
Client reported not being adherent because of substance use (i.e., drugs)
Client reported not being adherent because of stigma/disclosure concerns
Client reported not being adherent because of a lack of food
Client reported not being adherent because of poor palatability
Client reported not being adherent because of other reason
Client reported not being adherent because of other reason (specify)
Date on which client stopped ART
Reason why client intentionally stopped ART
Client stopped ART because of toxicity/side effects
Client stopped ART because of severe illness, hospitalization
Client stopped ART because of drugs being out of stock
Client stopped ART because client lacked finances
Client stopped ART because the infant was determined to not have HIV
Client stopped ART for other reason
Client stopped ART for other reason (specify)
